001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui;
002
003import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;
004import java.awt.event.KeyListener;
005import java.util.Iterator;
006import java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue;
007import java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue;
008import java.util.logging.Level;
009import java.util.logging.Logger;
010
011/**
012 * This is a KeyListener which consumes all key events and then allows them to be retrieved one at a
013 * time.
014 *
015 * Optionally blocks until input received when there are no events waiting.
016 *
017 * This listener is appropriate for a game loop driven application that regularly checks for user
018 * input. If your application is event driven then a standard java.awt.even.KeyListener would be
019 * more appropriate to use;
020 *
021 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
022 */
023public class SquidKey implements KeyListener, Iterable<KeyEvent>, Iterator<KeyEvent> {
024
025    /**
026     * Indicates when the capture should occur.
027     *
028     * If repeat keys should be captured when held down, then DOWN should be used.
029     *
030     * If complex character resolution is desired, such as 'A' or 'ctrl-alt-G' instead of seeing 'a'
031     * and a chain of 'ctrl' 'alt' 'shift' 'g' then TYPED should be used. An alternative is to call
032     * one of the methods from InputEvent that KeyEvent inherits, such as isShiftDown(), isAltDown(),
033     * isControlDown(), or the more complicated getModifiersEx() . In this case, you will still get
034     * keyPressed and keyReleased events for the modifier keys, but your handling of a KeyEvent can
035     * ignores those events. Instead, for example, you might see that 'g' was pressed, so you check
036     * isShiftDown() on the KeyEvent to see if it was really 'g' or 'G', determining whether the
037     * action is to (g)et an item or to (G)rapple a monster.
038     *
039     * Using UP only captures the individual keys when they are let go and in the order they are let
040     * go. This option is included for completion but is in most cases unlikely to have the desired
041     * behavior for reading input.
042     */
043    public enum CaptureType {
044
045        DOWN, UP, TYPED
046    };
047    private final CaptureType type;
048    private final BlockingQueue<KeyEvent> queue = new LinkedBlockingQueue<>();
049    private boolean blockOnEmpty, ignoreInput = false;
050
051    /**
052     * Creates a new listener which can optionally block when no input is currently available and
053     * will capture on key up or key down depending on the parameters.
054     *
055     * @param blockOnEmpty if true then this object will wait until there is input before returning
056     * from a request for the next event
057     * @param type
058     */
059    public SquidKey(boolean blockOnEmpty, CaptureType type) {
060        this.blockOnEmpty = blockOnEmpty;
061        this.type = type;
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * Creates a new listener which can optionally block when no input is currently available and
066     * will capture on key up or key down depending on the parameters.
067     *
068     * @param blockOnEmpty if true then this object will wait until there is input before returning
069     * from a request for the next event
070     * @param type
071     */
072    public SquidKey(boolean blockOnEmpty, CaptureType type, boolean ignoreInput) {
073        this.blockOnEmpty = blockOnEmpty;
074        this.type = type;
075        this.ignoreInput = ignoreInput;
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * Will set the blocking behavior to the provided block type.
080     * 
081     * Flushes anything currently in the queue.
082     * 
083     * @param block 
084     */
085    public void blockOnEmpty(boolean block){
086        blockOnEmpty = block;
087        flush();
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Empties the backing queue of data.
092     */
093    public void flush() {
094        queue.clear();
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Get the status for whether this should ignore input right now or not. True means this object will ignore and not
099     * queue keypresses, false means it should process them normally. Useful to pause processing or delegate it to
100     * another object temporarily.
101     * @return true if this object currently ignores input, false otherwise.
102     */
103    public boolean getIgnoreInput() {
104        return ignoreInput;
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * Set the status for whether this should ignore input right now or not. True means this object will ignore and not
109     * queue keypresses, false means it should process them normally. Useful to pause processing or delegate it to
110     * another object temporarily.
111     * @param ignoreInput true if this should object should ignore and not queue input, false otherwise.
112     */
113    public void setIgnoreInput(boolean ignoreInput) {
114        this.ignoreInput = ignoreInput;
115    }
116
117    @Override
118    public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e) {
119        if (type == CaptureType.TYPED && !ignoreInput) {
120            queue.offer(e);
121        }
122    }
123
124    @Override
125    public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e) {
126        if (type == CaptureType.DOWN && !ignoreInput) {
127            queue.offer(e);
128        }
129    }
130
131    @Override
132    public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e) {
133        if (type == CaptureType.UP && !ignoreInput) {
134            queue.offer(e);
135        }
136    }
137
138    @Override
139    public boolean hasNext() {
140        return !queue.isEmpty();
141    }
142
143    @Override
144    public Iterator<KeyEvent> iterator() {
145        return this;
146    }
147
148    /**
149     * Consumes the KeyEvent that is returned as it is returned.
150     *
151     * @return the next KeyEvent or null if there are no more
152     */
153    @Override
154    public KeyEvent next() {
155        KeyEvent ret = null;
156        if (blockOnEmpty) {
157            try {
158                ret = queue.take();
159            } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
160                Logger.getLogger(SquidKey.class.getName()).log(Level.SEVERE, null, ex);
161            }
162        } else {
163            ret = queue.poll();
164        }
165        return ret;
166    }
167
168    /**
169     * The remove operation is not supported by this class.
170     */
171    @Override
172    public void remove() {
173        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
174    }
175}
